name: Pixel Parlor
tagline: A Design Studio In Sunny Philadelphia
description:
Hello! Pixel Parlor is a design studio in sunny Philadelphia, founded by husband and wife designers Andrew Nicholas and Jenn Richey Nicholas. Their experience in print and interactive design has allowed them to work with some of the most interesting clients on the East Coast. Andrew Nicholas is the founding partner of Pixel Parlor. His experience in interactive design has allowed him to work for retail, performing arts and fine arts organizations.
His playful illustrative style has been seen in print campaigns throughout the City of New York and on global websites. He holds a BFA from the College of Design at North Carolina State University, and a minor in Film Studies. When not in front of his Mac creating, he can be found cycling, identifying weeds and taking photographs at every turn. Jenn has seen the inner workings of many design studios, from large to small. She worked on the design team for the New York City 2012 Olympic Bid, designed indie rock DVDs, dozens of architecture and planning proposals, and even a shrine to Richard Branson. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions, or are interested in working with Pixel Parlor. Cheers!
